subquestions.question_text: Describe the effect of changing the allocation of bits used for the mantissa and for the exponent in a floating-point number with a fixed total number of bits.
subquestions.answer: When the number of bits in the mantissa is raised, the precision/accuracy of the number represented increases; when the number of bits in the mantissa is lowered, the precision/accuracy of the number represented reduces. When the number of bits in the exponent is reduced, the range of numbers that can be represented is reduced; when the number of bits in the exponent is increased, the range of possible numbers that can be represented increases. When the range increases the accuracy decreases; when the range decreases the accuracy increases.
answer_conditions: When the number of bits in the mantissa is raised, the precision/accuracy of the number represented increases
When the number of bits in the mantissa is lowered, the precision/accuracy of the number represented reduces
When the number of bits in the exponent is reduced, the range of numbers that can be represented is reduced
When the number of bits in the exponent is increased, the range of possible numbers that can be represented increases
When the range increases the accuracy decreases
When the range decreases the accuracy increases

subquestions.question_text:
Explain the meaning of the phrase:

BitTorrent protocol provides peer-to-peer file sharing.
subquestions.answer: BitTorrent allows the sharing of files between thousands of users who are connected together over the internet. It allows more users to share files with each other than would be the case with a peer-to-peer network. Users share files directly with each other; the users' computers are acting as peers. No web server/central device is used; all users are of equal status.
answer_conditions: BitTorrent allows the sharing of files between thousands of users who are connected together over the internet
It allows more users to share files with each other than would be the case with a peer-to-peer network
Users share files directly with each other; the users' computers are acting as peers
No web server/central device is used; all users are of equal status

subquestions.question_text:
Sheila has a customer called Fred. Fred wants to send Sheila a confidential document as part of a transaction.

Explain how Fred uses asymmetric encryption to send his document securely.
subquestions.answer: Sheila's computer uses an algorithm to generate a matching pair of keys private and public. Sheila's computer sends Fred's computer Sheila's public key. Fred's computer encrypts the document/plain text using Sheila's public key to create cipher text. Fred's computer sends the cipher text to Sheila's computer. The cipher text can only be decrypted using Sheila's private key. Sheila's computer uses Sheila's private key to decrypt the cipher text.
answer_conditions: Sheila's computer uses an algorithm to generate a matching pair of keys private and public
Sheila's computer sends Fred's computer Sheila's public key
Fred's computer encrypts the document/plain text using Sheila's public key to create cipher text
Fred's computer sends the cipher text to Sheila's computer. The cipher text can only be decrypted using Sheila's private key. Sheila's computer uses Sheila's private key to decrypt the cipher text
